archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Film Footage of the State of Virginia, 1980s-2003
did.abstract: This collection contains 35 Betacam tapes (also available on 9 DVDs) of raw video footage featuring locations throughout Virginia, including Williamsburg, Richmond, Lake Prince, and Alexandria.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Film Footage of the State of Virginia must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Film Footage of the State of Virginia, Ms2010-024, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Film Footage of the State of Virginia was purchased by Special Collections in 2010.

altformavail.head: Alternate Form Available
altformavail.p: DVD master and use copies are available in Box 1 of the collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Film Footage of the State of Virginia was completed in May 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains 35 Betacam tapes (also available on 9 DVDs) of raw video footage featuring locations throughout Virginia, including Williamsburg, Richmond, Lake Prince, and Alexandria. The film was shot over several years, during the 1980s, 1990s, and up through 2003. This is raw footage and contains no audio. Wherever possible, details of what was filmed is available in the "Contents List" of the finding aid.

did.unittitle: Arlington, Lake Prince, Prince William, Shenandoah Valley, State of Virginia, Westminster-Canterbury, and Williamsburg footage, DVDs 1-9 (2 Copies-Master and Use).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Tape 1: Arlington Cemetery
Changing of the Guard; Tome of Unknown Soldiers; USS Maine Masthead; Nurses Memorial; Robert Kennedy; JFK & the Eternal Flame; Views of Washington, D.C.
Tape 2

Eternal Flame & JFK; Robert Kennedy; View of Washington, D.C.; Arlington House; Interview with Agnes Mullen; Portrait of Robert E. Lee; Interior and Exterior of Arlington House; Theodore Roosevelt Island; Skyscraper Views; Roosevelt Statue and Fountains
Tape 3
Tape 4
Fashion Center at Pentagon City; Rockin Trolls Entertainment; Food Court; Ethnic Restaurants; People Dining
Tape 5
Tape 6
Manassas Museum; Train Station; Dolls and Toys at Museum of Antique Cars; Manassas Battlefield; Stonewall Jackson; Cannons
Tape 7
Tourists; Manassas View of Hill; Interview with Doug Harvey; Museum Exterior; Streets; Potomac Mills
Tape 8
Potomac Mills; Interview with Lynne Mitchell
Tape 9
Weems-Botts Museum; Forest Park; Quantico; Occoquan; Interview with Mark Mosley

did.unittitle: Shenandoah Valley and Westminster-Canterbury, Virginia, Tapes 1-4, 1998.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Tape 1
Fredericksburg; Sunken Road; Stonewall National Cemetery; 1st Standup VA; 2nd Standup Chatham Manor; B-roll
Tape 2
B-roll Chatham Manor; Rising Sun Tavern; Standups and Wench Interview; Kenmore B-roll; Mary Washington House
Tape 3
Monument Row; Museum of the Confederacy; White House of the Confederacy; Tredegar; Standups on River
Tape 4
James River standup; River Rafting; City Skyline; Battle Re-enactment
Tape 5
Appamattox; Standup at McClean's; McClean's B-roll; Surrender's Triangle; Courthouse; Hall of Valor Standups and B-roll

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Tapes 1-3 contains standups.
